org.microtitan.tests.montecarlo

Class Cube

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microtitan.tests.montecarlo.Cube

  • public class Cube
extends java.lang.Object
    Cube whose "lower left-hand side" sits on the origin.
    Author:
    Robert Philipp

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cube

        public Cube(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> dimensions)
        Constructor for an n-dimensial cube, where n is the size of the specified dimensions list
        Parameters:
        dimensions - The list of dimensions. For example, a 3-d unit cube would be ( 1, 1, 1 ).

      • Cube

        public Cube(java.lang.Double... dimensions)
        Constructor for an n-dimensial cube, where n is the size of the specified dimensions list
        Parameters:
        dimensions - The list of dimensions. For example, a 3-d unit cube would be ( 1, 1, 1 ).

    • Method Detail

      • getDimension

        public int getDimension()
        Returns:
        The number of dimensions. For example, a 3-d cube would return 3

      • getDimension

        public double getDimension(int dimension)
        Returns the dimension for the specified dimension. Confused? Yeah so am I. Suppose you have a 3-d cube specified by ( pi, 2pi, 6pi). Then the first dimension would be pi, and the third dimension, 6pi.
        Parameters:
        dimension - The number of the dimension for which to return the dimension.
        Returns:
        The dimension of the specified dimension

      • getDimensions

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getDimensions()
        Returns:
        a list of the dimensions.

      • isInside

        public boolean isInside(java.lang.Double... point)
        Returns true if the specified point falls within this cube; false otherwise
        Parameters:
        point - The point to test
        Returns:
        true if the specified point falls within this cube; false otherwise

      • isInside

        public boolean isInside(java.util.List<java.lang.Double> point)
        Returns true if the specified point falls within this cube; false otherwise
        Parameters:
        point - The point to test
        Returns:
        true if the specified point falls within this cube; false otherwise

      • isContained

        public boolean isContained(Cube cube)
        Returns true if the specified cube is entirely within this cube; otherwise false. Really, this is just asking whether a point is inside the cube, because all cubes have on corner on the origin.
        Parameters:
        cube - The cube to test for containment
        Returns:
        true if the specified cube is entirely within this cube; otherwise false

      • getVolume

        public double getVolume()
        Returns:
        The n-dimensional volume of the cube.

        public static void main(java.lang.String... args)
